Alpine succulents üèûÔ∏è I never really realised we have native succulents in Europe for a long time and after many years of collecting I went out to find them in the wild. Last summer I went hiking in the Alps and managed to find quite a few Sedum, Saxifraga, and Sempervivum üíö
‚Å£‚Å£ 
1-2. Saxifraga paniculata var. minutifolia‚Å£‚Å£
3. Sedum sarmentosum‚Å£‚Å£
4. Sempervivum barbulatum‚Å£‚Å£
5. Sedum (unknown)‚Å£‚Å£
6-8. Sedum alpestre‚Å£‚Å£
9. Sedum (unknown)‚Å£‚Å£

Crassula muscosa üåº After 4 years it's finally in bloom for the first time! I keep it mostly in a corner without much care, under grow lights, and don't pay much attention to it. It likely needs a repotting some time next spring as it's definitely outgrowing its current pot üòÖ

#crassula #crassulamuscosa #flowers #flowerstagram #succulentflower #succulents #succulentsofinstagram #succulentlove #instasucculent #plants #plantsofinstagram #plantsmakepeoplehappy #houseplants #houseplantclub #houseplantsofinstagram #houseplantcommunity #cactus #cactuslover

Sedum hintonii üíö I got it as a really small cutting last year (basically the size of the overhanging right end) and it finally took off this summer. Look at all the exploding growth! Will need a new pot next year I guess üò¨

Sempervivum arachnoideum, named after its resemblance of spider webs, in full bloom üå∫ Native to the Alps, unfortunately it dies after flowering! There is good news though, all its offshoots will continue to live on and grow even more offshoots until they eventually flower as well.

Euphorbia decaryi is native to Madagascar and grows the tiniest flowers I have in my succulent garden currently, only 4mm in size! üò¨

My Chilean friend Copiapoa hypogaea in bloom üåº I absolutely love the grey-brown coloring, so unusual. I can't take credit for the flower though, as I just got this little fella about 2 month ago. I will do my best to create the conditions so it can flower next year again ü§ûüèªüòâ #cactusflower #cactus #kaktus #cactusofinstagram #cactuslover #cactusflowers #cacti #flowersofinstagram #flowers #flowerstagram #flowerphotography #flower #flowerpower #instaflowers #succulentsofinstagram #succulentobsession #succulents #succulentflower #succulentaddict #succulentcollector #plantsüåø #plantlover #plantsofinstagram #plantstagram #houseplantsofinstagram #houseplantclub #houseplantlove #houseplantcommunity

Did you know we have native succulents in Europe? Sedum hispanicum (1) and Sedum album (2) are one of them üåø I picked both plants as small cuttings last year; hispanicum in Spain and album in  Slovenia. I left them outside all winter as a ground cover of my succulent pot. They're absolutely exploding right now, I can almost watch them grow! Every day they take over more space üíö

Gymnocalycium bruchii ssp. brigittae! One of my first outdoor cacti, outside on my balcony since 4 weeks. It started blooming a couple of days ago and it's just beautiful. Still waiting for any bees or other insect to visit üåºüêù #gymnocalyciumlover #gymnocalycium #gymnocalyciumbruchii #gymnocalyciumflower #flowersofinstagram #flowers #flowerstagram #flower #flowerphotography #instaflowers #instagymnocalycium #cactusflower #cactusofinstagram #cactuslover #cactusflowers #cactus #cacti #cactuslove #instacactus #instasucculent #succulentsofinstagram #succulentobsession #winterhardy #plantsmakepeoplehappy #plantsofinstagram #plantlover #houseplantsofinstagram #houseplantclub #houseplants #houseplantlove

Flowering Cotyledon tomentosa üèµÔ∏è This flower has been in progress for over a month now and finally opened! It's stunning! I should've probably waited with the photos a few days longer until the other buds are opened as well, but I'm too happy to wait üíö

Adenia glauca! I love everything about this plant: the caudex, the structure, and most of all the leaves üçÉ It grows so fast! Every day it has a different look and was completely blank just two weeks ago.

Ariocarpus retusus v. elongatus üåµ One of my favorite, unusual looking cactus species. Just put it in its new pot last weekend üè∫

Tiny Crassula sarcocaulis tree üå≥ Those are just cuttings, but they looked too perfect together to throw them away. Let's see if I manage to grow them in a clump style bonsai üòÇ

Flower stalk of my Aloe vera üèµÔ∏è This is one of the plants I usually ignore most in my apartment, simply because I find it quite boring to be honest, but I think especially this lack of care makes it thrive so much. It's in a huge pot, overgrowing, and gets the direct sun and heat every day. This spring it started to flower for the first time and ever since I am watching it develop impatiently every day. Today the first flower opened up and I just have to share it üíö

Senecio rowleyanus, also called string of perls. A very common succulent houseplant. I got this one last December and it has been growing very quick so far. I will likely repot it some time this summer

Sedum hernandezii üå± This one is a little bit etiolated, seems like my grow lights are just not enough. But I just learned today that they're winter-hardy and can be kept outside until -6¬∞C! It started growing again a few weeks ago and I think I will move it outside permanently this year.

#sedum #sedumhernandezii #succulents #succulentsofinstagram #succulentcollector #succulentlove #succulentobsession #succulentgarden #instasucculent #houseplantsofinstagram #houseplantclub #houseplants #houseplansofinstagram #balconyplants #houseplantcommunity #cactusofinstagram

Leuchtenbergia principis, now in its new pot. This cactus has a large, single taproot and kinda resembles an Agave. This is one of my many favorites, because of its unusual look. It's super slow growing and I've barely seen any changes in the year I got it. Fingers crossed for some growth this summer!

#leuchtenbergiaprincipis

Adenium obesum, one year later. The past summer was a real success for this little friend. Look at the last photo and you can see how much of a belly it grew! I cut it back one month ago, right before its new leaves were coming out.

Update on my Mammillaria bocasana cv. Fred üåµ Since my last post a year ago I repotted it and it's still going strong. It's under grow lights all the time which causes quite a bit of stress coloring here, but I like it.

My super tiny Pseudolithos cubiformus, which is not yet cube shaped! I'm patiently waiting for it to get bigger and grow into a cube. One of my favorite succulents, just because it looks so alien. It has no leaves, only this leathery texture. It's a blob! üå±

This is your boring office plant Zamioculcas zamiifolia, often called "ZZ plant" üåø I've got this one for about 4 years now, mostly ignored, and finally it bloomed for the first time. The flower looks pretty weird though (I hope it's just a flower). I love it!

Echeveria pulvinata üå±  Today was a very sunny day since a long time and I just had to share an update on my mini Echeveria pulvinata forest. Since I've put them together like this last year, they've recovered quite well. A lot of aerial roots and the leaves developed their typical coloring. Really looking forward to more growth and development üíö
